meanings.definition: To enslave or make a slave of
meanings.sent1: The evil sorcerer sought to beslave the entire village with his dark magic.
meanings.sent2: The conquerors would often beslave the captured people to work in the mines.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous gnome tried to beslave the cookies in the jar, but they were too well-guarded.
meanings.sent4: The hypnotic melody seemed to beslave the audience, holding them in a trance-like state.
meanings.sent5: The powerful warlock could beslave the minds of his enemies with a single glance.

meanings.definition: To work as a slave or in a slave-like manner
meanings.sent1: Despite his royal blood, the prince chose to beslave alongside the common folk to understand their struggles.
meanings.sent2: The brave knight refused to beslave under the tyrannical ruler, standing up for what was right.
meanings.sent3: The lazy cat pretended to beslave around the house, but in reality, it was just napping all day.
meanings.sent4: The relentless storm seemed to beslave the entire town, forcing everyone to seek shelter indoors.
meanings.sent5: The enchanting aroma of freshly baked bread would beslave the senses of anyone passing by the bakery.
